poem:
Title: "On The Wealth of Innocence"

Child-poor, tattered innocence,
no pennies in their trust.
Not workers, but gatherers of senses
feeding on crumbs of knowledge,
hungering for brightly coloured dreams.

In tyranny's shadow, stunted youth,
fed on meagre portions of despair,
Yet, in each ragged ragamuffin, a wealth
beyond large economies.

Because even a heart emptied,
by the sturdy hands of poverty
is richer than a chest full of cold coin.
